system
Class GamePhysics

java.lang.Object
  system.GamePhysics
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class GamePhysics
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

The GamePhysics represents all the physics within the Bomberman game. This implements the interface Runnable. It contains thirteen methods and the methods defines collisions between the player, bombs, and blocks within the Bomberman game.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Brett Leighton, Leotard Niyonkuru, Marc-Andre Cataford, Mete Kemertas, Martin Zhang

Nested Class Summary
static class GamePhysics.CollisionType
          This enum represents the various types of collisions in the game

Constructor Detail

GamePhysics

public GamePhysics(GameStatus gs)
This method intakes the GameStatus to be used by the other methods

Parameters:
gs - this takes in the GameStatus to be used
Method Detail

run

public void run()
This method calls the other methods in the GamePhysics class and starts a timer which runs every 100 ms to check for actions in the Bomberman Game. It also moves enemies every 600 ms.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

collidesWith

public boolean collidesWith(MapObject obj1,
                            MapObject obj2,
                            GamePhysics.CollisionType type)
This method checks collisions between map objects in the game and returns true if any of the collision types occur. Otherwise this returns false.

Parameters:
obj1 - This is the first map object being checked
obj2 - This is the second map object being collided upon
type - One of the collision type: UP,DOWN,LEFT,RIGHT,OVERLAP
Returns:

canMove

public boolean canMove(MapObject obj,
                       GamePhysics.CollisionType type)
This method checks if it is possible for the player or enemy to move in the game. If the player or the enemy is colliding with a bomb or a block, it is not possible to move.

Parameters:
obj - The player or enemy that is trying to move
type - The direction which the player/enemy is trying to move
Returns:
If it possible to move

canPlaceBomb

public boolean canPlaceBomb(Player p)
This method checks if it is possible for the player to place a bomb. It takes an input player and checks if the player is either overlapping with any objects in the game or over the bomb limit.

Parameters:
p - Takes an input the player
Returns:
If it is possible to place a bomb

hitsEnemy

public boolean hitsEnemy(MapObject obj,
                         GamePhysics.CollisionType type)
This method checks if an object has hit an enemy. It takes an input object and returns true if the object has collided with the enemy and false otherwise.

Parameters:
obj - Takes as input the object to be checked
Returns:
If the player has hit an enemy

hitsPlayer

public boolean hitsPlayer(Enemy enemy)
This method checks if the enemy has hit a player. It takes as input an enemy and returns true if the enemy has hit a player and false otherwise.

Parameters:
enemy - Takes as input the enemy being checked
Returns:
If the enemy has hit a player

explodeBomb

public void explodeBomb(int index)
This method explodes the bomb and sets the size of the explosion. It takes as input an integer index which identifies the specific bomb. It also checks if the explosion is able to take place. At the end of the method it removes the bomb from the index to allow a new bomb to be placed.

Parameters:
index - This takes as input the index of the Bomb which identifies it.

checkPowerupCollisions

public void checkPowerupCollisions()
This method checks if a player has collided with a powerup. If the player has collided with a powerup, it tells the player to consume the powerup and to take the powerup off the map.

checkExplosionCollisions

public void checkExplosionCollisions()
This method checks if the explosion collided with other objects on the map and destroys the object if it is an enemy, player, or a soft block.

removeDeadObjects

public void removeDeadObjects()
This method removes all dead objects on the map as well as explodes the bomb if when the timer runs out. The method also switches players for multi-player mode if the player dies. Moreover, it plays a sound when the player dies.

checkGameWon

public void checkGameWon()
This method checks if the player has completed a level and goes to the next level if there are no more enemies on the map.

checkGameOver

public void checkGameOver()
This method checks if the player has run out of lives and if the player has, the method then ends the game.

moveEnemies

public void moveEnemies()
This method runs through the enemies arry using a for loop and moves them randomly It also kills the player if the enemy moves into the player

moveRandom

public void moveRandom(LivingUnit lu)
This method moves an enemy randomly according to a random number generator with a 2/5 chance to not move at all and a 3/5 chance to move either up,down,left or right. This is only true if the direction in which the enemy is suppose to move does not result in a collision.

Parameters:
lu - takes as input a living unit to move randomly
